title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments: Little terrorist is a damn good film. Just 15 min long and we had to write a movie report on it in school. I highly recommend it
Watching Jujutsu Kaisen, such a good shounen

Watched Le Prénom (Whats in the name?) its french movie about get together of childhood friends in which on them chooses his unborn Son name Adolf, story revolving around all friends life. Seriously yhis is one of best comedy drama.

Hi! I've just finished FMA: Brotherhood

Would like recommendations on what to watch next? 

So far I've watched Naruto + Shippuden, Demon Slayer, Ju Jutsu Kaisen, Noragami, Promised Wonderland.


On the other hand I've watched Incendies this week, very good movie. I suggest you guys to go in blind. 

Brawl in Cell Block 99, Wind River, Bone Tomahawk were all amazing. But I personally loved bone tomahawk the most among them. I do suggest them.
Watched Newsroom. You often hear about freedom that western media enjoys. Guess what, it's as polarizing as the Indian counterpart.

newsroom is not the real-world depiction. more idealistic in nature, but fantastic series nonetheless. Ended too soon.

But you are right about the polarizing media part of it in general. Indian politics and media seems to learn from them.

Of course, it's fiction but my point was that we usually idealize western media, but it is far from ideal. In any case, it is a good light serial. Nothing great, but if you enjoy light humor mixed with drama, it's pretty good.

>idealize western media

Oh, I have seen the western media from up close. The mainstream is so shit! I guess those who idealizes their media must have only seen the niche, good quality journalism. I'm sure if someone saw their mainstream media, they will vomit.

By the way, if you liked Newsroom, you might also like other works by Aaron Sorkin. Also try the 'The morning show' from Apple TV.
I’ve been listening to the Khooni podcast and the TOI podcast.

Hi! For Anime it seems like you're enjoying shounen rn, I recommend Haikyuu (my favorite shounen, it's about Volleyball but you'll love it for sure), My hero Academia, and Death Note if you haven't already.

As for anime not shounen try Steins;Gate, One Punch man. Have fun!
Finished Money Heist volume 5 part 1.... Heavy in action, Weak in Plot ...still a decent watch...
Yes, I have been meaning to give a try to The Morning Show.

If you're into less action, more fantasy/adventure related Japanese anime, you should definitely check out Studio Ghibli films. Definitely an interesting list of films to watch.

In the TV show section, watch One-Punch Man (shorter seasons), Bleach (series has ended, last set of anime being produced) and Attack on Titan (wow dude, very well done).
Distractible Podcast and Conan O Brien Needs a Friend
